We're Hiring


Student Involvement is hiring for Fall 2023! Open positions include Student Involvement Programming Assistants (PEAPs) and Summer Orientation Leaders. Apply on Handshake, by email, or by Google Form (PEAP version | Summer Orientation version). Apply by April 1, 2023!



  






You are hereAbout Student Involvement › Fraternity and Sorority Life › How to Join ›  
Interfraternity Council (IFC)






The Interfraternity Council (IFC) is the governing and representative body for five national and international fraternities. The council acts as a sounding board between member organizations and serves as a place to discuss questions of mutual interest and devise common solutions. Additionally, IFC meetings function as a common meeting ground to freely exchange ideas and perpetuate the growth of all member fraternities. The organizations place a significant emphasis on scholarship, civic engagement, leadership, and personal development.
Learn more about the Interfraternity Council on their IFC Involve page.
